bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of various academic departments and programs of Villanova University. Types of materials found in the department records include faculty meeting minutes, correspondence, annual departmental reports, and program brochures. The programs with the most material in this collection are Library Sciences and the NROTC program. Other departments and programs documented here include Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Education and Human Services, Mathematics, Physics, Theater, Theology and Religion, Women's Studies, and the Internship program.
